Description: Two beads of different shape and material. A: Bead in the shape of a stylized cowrie-shell, made of white glass with the opening line of the shell imitated in a blue glazed line on both sides. The shape is oval and slightly flattened. B: Disc-shaped bead made of turquoise faience.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E4.4, north low level
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
